intro: Calyptranthes oligantha, commonly known as the slender calyptranthes, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white or pale pink flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Calyptranthes oligantha is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as undergrowth in tropical forests.
